intro: Thelocephala krausii, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white to yellow florets in its inflorescence. Thelocephala krausii is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought-resistant properties.
